meanings.definition: To change course by shifting the sail of a boat from one side to the other.
meanings.sent1: The sailor gybed the boat to avoid the rocks.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the captain decided to gybe to catch the wind from a different direction.
meanings.sent3: When the wind suddenly changed, the sailor had to gybe quickly to stay on course.
meanings.sent4: The decision to gybe towards the sunset brought a sense of adventure to the journey.
meanings.sent5: With a swift gybe, the boat surged forward, leaving a trail of foam behind.
